title: Giant anti-government rally in Belgrade over mass shootings
description: Huge crowds of anti-government protesters on Saturday encircled the Serbian state television building in downtown Belgrade to press their demand for autocratic President Aleksandar Vucic to ease his tight grip on the mainstream media.

title: Over 1,500 arrested at climate protest in the Netherlands
description: Activists blocked a section of a highway in the center of The Hague, in protest against Dutch fossil fuel subsidies. Several celebrities were among the protesters, including actress Carice van Houten, best known for her role as Melisandre in "Game of Thrones."

title: Cannes 2023: The winners of this year's competition
description: "Anatomy of a Fall", a tense courtroom drama about a writer accused of her husband's murder, took the Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival on Saturday, capping a strong year for women directors.

title: In Germany, the blues of young anti-Erdogan Turks
description: The Turkish community living in Germany is expected to vote for incumbent Recep Tayyip Erdogan in the second round of the presidential election on Sunday.

title: US says Russia's Wagner tried to use Mali to arm itself in Ukraine
description: An intelligence document reveals that Yevgeny Prigozhin's mercenary group tried to buy arms from Turkey through Bamako.

title: Pilot study identifies widespread presence of pesticides in French agricultural soils
description: Over 100 molecules were detected at 47 sites across France. At least one agent was found on 46 of the 47 sites examined, including on land that had never been sprayed.

title: Tongoro, the Senegalese label that dresses Beyoncé and Naomi Campbell
description: Launched in 2016 in Dakar, Tongoro, a brand prized by showbiz stars, is enjoying international success. Its creator, Sarah Diouf, promotes African know-how and hopes to inspire other designers on the continent.

title: 'Violence against women and garbage dump planet shake up Cannes bubble'
description: The Cannes Film Festival, which ends on Saturday, will be remembered for its distinctive flavor, writes Michel Guerrin. Social issues, long confined to the screen, spilled over onto the Croisette this time.

title: Pope accepts resignation of French archbishop
description: Archbishop of Strasbourg Luc Ravel stepped down last month following criticism of his management style.

title: Peru on the front line of  trafficking cultural treasures
description: The country brimming with thousands of archaeological sites is doing its best to curb the illegal trade, which has reached proportions approaching those of drugs and weapons.

title: US: Transgender people targeted by growing number of bills restricting rights
description: Since the beginning of the year, 549 bills opposing transgender rights have been introduced. So far, 73 have been passed or put into effect, all in Republican-controlled states.

title: Hundreds of German civil servants to leave Russia
description: A close economic partner with Russia before Moscow invaded Ukraine, Germany has since moved away from Moscow, financially and militarily supporting Kyiv.

title: Cannes 2023: Festival ends, suspense mounts
description: While Britain's Ken Loach could enter the pantheon of cinema by becoming the first director to win a third Palme d'Or in his lifetime on Saturday, the top prize of the 76th edition could also be awarded to Justine Triet.

title: 'This is where I was born': Resigned residents watch slum's demolition in French Indian Ocean territory
description: In an operation billed as fighting illegal immigration and crime, the French government ordered the destruction of the Talus 2 neighborhood in the island territory of Mayotte. Inhabitants are worried about their rehousing conditions and their future.

title: Colonial Belgium stripped them of rights for being mixed race. Now they seek reparations
description: Five women born to a Congolese mother and a Belgian father are in court over Belgium's policy of removing 'mulâtre' children from their maternal families and placing them in institutions.

title: Paris 2024: The touchy subject of air conditioning in the Olympic Village
description: The organizers have opted for rooms without air conditioning for environmental purposes, but the increasing number of heat waves in France has led to fears of recovery problems for the athletes.

title: Macron, sociologists and the middle class: A secret Elysée luncheon
description: On Tuesday, the French president lunched with four researchers who project the country toward an 'ecological civilization.' From their discussion, Macron took away the controversial term 'decivilization.'

title: French Open: Lucas Pouille's comeback after a hellish personal journey
description: On the verge of retirement in the fall of 2022, the French player, former world number 10 who fell beyond the 600th rank due to injuries and depression, qualified on Thursday for the tournament's main draw.

title: Twitter drops out of voluntary agreement to combat online disinformation
description: European Commissioner Thierry Breton tweeted that Twitter had pulled out of the EU's disinformation 'code of practice' that other major social media platforms have pledged to support.

title: Pink Floyd's Roger Waters slammed for 'Nazi' suit in Germany
description: Berlin police said Friday they were probing Waters after images of the Pink Floyd co-founder circulated on social media, showing him wearing a long, black coat with red armbands on stage at the Mercedes-Benz arena last week.
